item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. One in four 2020 Tesla Model 3 failed the Danish periodic inspection in 2024 (35 points | 6 comments)
2. Show HN: Making AR experiences is still painful – had to make my own editor (42 points | 6 comments)
3. Hedy: Textual programming made easy (74 points | 6 comments)
4. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (239 points | 53 comments)
5. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (202 points | 71 comments)
6. Show HN: Bagels – TUI expense tracker (114 points | 27 comments)
7. Hackers get $886,250 for 49 zero-days at Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 (19 points | 6 comments)
8. Supercharge SQLite with Ruby Functions (35 points | 8 comments)
9. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (459 points | 323 comments)
10. Using generative AI as part of historical research: three case studies (203 points | 170 comments)
11. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy your own Qwen with context length up to 1M tokens (204 points | 76 comments)
12. Show HN: 3D printing giant things with a Python jigsaw generator (100 points | 15 comments)
13. Why Liquidity Matters (16 points | discuss)
14. Shunpo: Minimalist bash tool to make directory navigation a little bit faster (69 points | 27 comments)
15. Marginalia – A search engine that prioritizes non-commercial content (356 points | 29 comments)
16. OpenJazz is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games (117 points | 15 comments)
17. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (161 points | 39 comments)
18. Wikenigma – An Encyclopedia of Unknowns (39 points | 3 comments)
19. The impact of competition and DeepSeek on Nvidia (194 points | 95 comments)
20. Amsterdam Compiler Kit for Cray X-MP (76 points | 10 comments)
21. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (142 points | 77 comments)
22. Autodesk partially restores old forum posts (61 points | 11 comments)
23. Astronomers delete asteroid because it turned out to be Tesla Roadster (214 points | 67 comments)
24. No one is disrupting banks – at least not the big ones (131 points | 213 comments)
25. Once You're Laid Off, You'll Never Be the Same Again (4 points | discuss)
26. Hyperbound (YC S23) is hiring a Founding Account Executive in SF ( | hide)
27. Show HN: DeepSeek My User Agent (284 points | 114 comments)
28. Kansas tuberculosis outbreak is America's largest recorded since the 1950s (370 points | 290 comments)
29. If OpenSSL were a GUI (2022) (140 points | 45 comments)
30. The Microsoft 365 Copilot launch was a disaster (412 points | 392 comments)
